meanings.definition: To regain possession or control of something.
meanings.sent1: After losing his favorite toy, Tim worked hard at reattaining it.
meanings.sent2: She was determined to reattain her lost keys before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: The cat played a game of reattaining the feather toy from under the couch.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled detective, he reattained the missing evidence just in time.
meanings.sent5: The student focused on reattaining his concentration during the exam.

meanings.sent1: With practice, she hoped to reattain her previous high score in the game.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained hard to reattain his peak performance level.
meanings.sent3: The chef aimed to reattain the perfect balance of flavors in her dish.
meanings.sent4: The singer's voice soared, trying to reattain the high note she missed earlier.
meanings.sent5: The hiker pushed himself to reattain the summit before sunset.

meanings.definition: To regain a former state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The old house was renovated to reattain its original charm.
meanings.sent2: The patient worked diligently to reattain his health after the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The garden was reattained to its former beauty with new flowers.
meanings.sent4: The artist strove to reattain the emotional depth in her paintings.
meanings.sent5: The town aimed to reattain its reputation as a friendly community.
